meanings.definition: A space or room just below the roof of a house, often used for storage.
meanings.sent1: The attics in old houses are perfect for storing old toys and books.
meanings.sent2: We found some forgotten treasures in the dusty attics of the abandoned mansion.
meanings.sent3: The attic was so full of boxes that it looked like a giant puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like an attic, filled with memories stacked neatly in every corner.
meanings.sent5: The attic smelled of mothballs and memories, a time capsule of the past.

meanings.definition: The top floor or rooms of a building, typically under a sloping roof.
meanings.sent1: The attics of the old barn were home to a family of playful squirrels.
meanings.sent2: The attic windows offered a view of the neighborhood from above.
meanings.sent3: The attic felt like a secret hideout, hidden away from the rest of the world.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts raced like footsteps echoing in an empty attic.
meanings.sent5: The attic was a cozy retreat, away from the hustle and bustle of daily life.

meanings.definition: A small, cramped space under the roof of a building.
meanings.sent1: The attics in the old cottages were so tiny, you could barely stand up straight.
meanings.sent2: She heard mysterious creaks coming from the attic late at night.
meanings.sent3: The attic was like a hidden nook, perfect for secret meetings.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were stored in the attic of his mind, waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The attic was a dusty retreat, a place where forgotten dreams lingered.
